articles.headline: Charting test cheaters
articles.summary: This investigation explored unusual swings in standardized test scores at Wilmer Elementary, Texas, uncovering cheating facilitated by educators, rather than students, after the school's third-grade reading test scores skyrocketed unpredictedly.

articles.headline: Boat accident data sheds light on dangers
articles.summary: An analysis of boating accident data highlighted increased dangers on the Parker Strip of the Colorado River, triggering focus on alcohol-related incidents and inadequate law enforcement on waterways.

articles.headline: Finding overlap in public-private interests
articles.summary: Explorations into state government contracts in Wisconsin revealed a significant increase tied to campaign contributions, implicating a concerning blend of business and political interests.

articles.headline: 911 data shows system's shortcomings
articles.summary: A thorough investigation into Broward County’s 911 system expose significant delays and shortcomings, prompting systemic reforms and improvements in response time tracking.

articles.headline: Uncovering bad bridges at risk in mudslides
articles.summary: Investigation into the maintenance of Ventura County bridges uncovered numerous structurally deficient bridges and inadequate inspections, spotlighting public safety hazards after mudslides.
